{"step_by_step_thinking": "Salbutamol, also known as albuterol, is a medication used to treat asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). According to Document [0], common side effects of salbutamol include shakiness (tremors), fast heart rate (tachycardia), and low blood potassium levels (hypokalemia). However, there is no mention of hypoglycemia (low blood sugar levels) as a side effect of salbutamol in any of the provided documents.", "answer_choice": "C"}
